package.name: HTML_Page
package.summary: PEAR::HTML_Page is a base class for XHTML page generation.
package.description: The PEAR::HTML_Page package provides a simple interface for generating an XHTML compliant page. * supports virtually all HTML doctypes, from HTML 2.0 through XHTML 1.1 and XHTML Basic 1.0 plus preliminary support for XHTML 2.0 * namespace support * global language declaration for the document * line ending styles * full META tag support * support for stylesheet declaration in the head section * support for linked stylesheets and scripts * body can be a string, object with toHtml or toString methods or an array (can be combined)

release.notes: * added output to file functionality * added support for CSS2 media types for linked stylesheets
* Fixed notice when an array is passed to the constructor Now gives a notice when a string is passed (thanks to Laurent Laville)
* added inline script declaration in the head element Bugfixes: * fixed mime encoding declaration * fixed Content-Type meta tag generation * fixed style definition based on mime type

* added namespace support * added mime encoding type support * added content type meta tag generation support * preliminary XHTML 2.0 support (W3C Working Draft 6 May 2003) Bugfixes: * implemented conditionally unclosed empty tags for HTML compliance * fixed logic for doctype parsing
Bugfixes: * 24188: Updated examples * fixed problems with functions accepting mixed variable types * updated inline documentation

Note: This release breaks BC!
This beta release is completely XHTML compliant, and has some great features: * Line ending style * Full charset support * Doctype definitions * Global document language * Full META tag support, including "http-equiv" * Suport for stylesheet declaration in the head section * Support for linked stylesheets and scripts
Ideas for use: * Use to validate the output of a class for XHTML compliance * Quick prototyping using PEAR packages is now a breeze

Note: Legacy release! API will change in version 2.0!!
This is the first independent PEAR release. It creates an HTML framework for a page.
Features: * META tag support (no http-equiv tags) * Support for linked stylesheets and scripts
Ideas for use: * Quick prototyping using PEAR packages is now a breeze
